definition: to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: David meets with Betty to place an order.
sentences.chinese: 大卫与贝蒂碰面下订单。
我们在北京机场碰面吧。

sentences.english: They only see each other on the week-ends.
sentences.chinese: 他们只有在周末才会碰面。

sentences.english: The three candidates met in a series of debates.
sentences.chinese: 那三位候选人在一连串的辩论中碰面。

sentences.english: I'll meet you at the intersection of Heping and Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 我在和平跟罗斯福路交叉口和你碰面。

sentences.english: We meet at least twice each week at the Faculty association meetings.
sentences.chinese: 在每星期的教师协会例会上，我们至少有两次的碰面。

sentences.english: Leslie and Jan are meeting in the park.
sentences.chinese: 莱丝莉和珍在公园碰面。

sentences.english: We are going to meet at the bookstore in Huangpu District.
sentences.chinese: 我们将在黄浦区的那家书店碰面。

sentences.english: I meet her at a local pub.
sentences.chinese: 我和她约在当地的一家酒吧碰面。

sentences.english: They can steal away at night and join us.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以晚上偷偷溜出来和我们碰面。

sentences.english: Hang out with your long-time friends more and contact those with whom you have lost touch.
sentences.chinese: 多多与多年老友碰面，重新找到失去联系的朋友。

sentences.english: I'll meet you at the movies right after I take a little catnap .
sentences.chinese: 我先打个盹再到电影院和你碰面。

sentences.english: I always have to meet her before she hooks up with this Rodolphe character.
sentences.chinese: 我永远得在她和鲁道夫那角色勾搭上之前和她碰面。

sentences.english: I'm meeting a friend here.What are you doing here?
sentences.chinese: 我跟朋友在这碰面，你在这里做什么？

sentences.english: Could I leave a message for Bobbie to meet me at noon tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 我可以留个话，请巴比明天中午与我碰面吗？

sentences.english: If nothing else, Barcelona will meet Manchester United in the final.
sentences.chinese: 不出意外的话，巴萨将在决赛与曼联碰面。

definition: to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to see each other/to meet in person
clash that leaves both sides shattered
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
enemy/foe/(in opera) sweetheart or destined love
